pageProps.contentHtml:
density argument, measure theory

Let {μn}\set{\mu_n}{μn​} denote a sequence of Borel probability measures on R\RR. For n∈Nn \in \Nn∈N and x∈Rx \in \Rx∈R we define

Fn(x)=μn((−∞,x]).F_n\p{x} = \mu_n\p{\poc{-\infty, x}}.Fn​(x)=μn​((−∞,x]).

Suppose the sequence {Fn}n\set{F_n}_n{Fn​}n​ converges uniformly on R\RR. Show that then for every bounded continuous function f ⁣:R→R\func{f}{\R}{\R}f:R→R the numbers

∫Rf(x) dμn(x)\int_\R f\p{x} \,\diff\mu_n\p{x}∫R​f(x)dμn​(x)

converge as n→∞n \to \inftyn→∞.
Solution.

First, let f=∑k=1Nckχ(ak,bk]f = \sum_{k=1}^N c_k \chi_{\poc{a_k,b_k}}f=∑k=1N​ck​χ(ak​,bk​]​, where −∞≤ak≤bk≤∞-\infty \leq a_k \leq b_k \leq \infty−∞≤ak​≤bk​≤∞ and the (ak,bk]\poc{a_k, b_k}(ak​,bk​] are pairwise disjoint. Then

∣∫f dμn−∫f dμm∣=∣∑k=1N(ck(Fn(bk)−Fn(ak))−ck(Fm(bk)−Fm(ak)))∣≤∑k=1N∣ck∣(∣Fn(bk)−Fm(bk)∣+∣Fn(ak)−Fm(ak)∣).\begin{aligned} \abs{\int f \,\diff\mu_n - \int f \,\diff\mu_m} &= \abs{\sum_{k=1}^N \p{c_k\p{F_n\p{b_k} - F_n\p{a_k}} - c_k\p{F_m\p{b_k} - F_m\p{a_k}}}} \\ &\leq \sum_{k=1}^N \abs{c_k} \p{\abs{F_n\p{b_k} - F_m\p{b_k}} + \abs{F_n\p{a_k} - F_m\p{a_k}}}. \end{aligned}∣∣​∫fdμn​−∫fdμm​∣∣​​=∣∣​k=1∑N​(ck​(Fn​(bk​)−Fn​(ak​))−ck​(Fm​(bk​)−Fm​(ak​)))∣∣​≤k=1∑N​∣ck​∣(∣Fn​(bk​)−Fm​(bk​)∣+∣Fn​(ak​)−Fm​(ak​)∣).​

Since {Fn}n\set{F_n}_n{Fn​}n​ converges uniformly, it is uniformly Cauchy, so this quantity tends to 000 as n,m→∞n, m \to \inftyn,m→∞. This proves the result for simple functions.

Since {Fn}n\set{F_n}_n{Fn​}n​ is uniformly Cauchy, there exists N∈NN \in \NN∈N such that if n,m≥Nn, m \geq Nn,m≥N, then ∣Fn(x)−Fm(x)∣<ε\abs{F_n\p{x} - F_m\p{x}} < \epsilon∣Fn​(x)−Fm​(x)∣<ε for any x∈Rx \in \Rx∈R. Since μN\mu_NμN​ is a finite measure, we can apply downward continuity to get R>0R > 0R>0 such that FN(−R)=μN(−∞,−R)<εF_N\p{-R} = \mu_N\p{-\infty, -R} < \epsilonFN​(−R)=μN​(−∞,−R)<ε. Thus, for n≥Nn \geq Nn≥N,

∣Fn(−R)∣≤∣FN(−R)−Fn(−R)∣+∣FN(−R)∣≤2ε.\abs{F_n\p{-R}} \leq \abs{F_N\p{-R} - F_n\p{-R}} + \abs{F_N\p{-R}} \leq 2\epsilon.∣Fn​(−R)∣≤∣FN​(−R)−Fn​(−R)∣+∣FN​(−R)∣≤2ε.

By applying the same argument to 1−Fn(x)1 - F_n\p{x}1−Fn​(x) and making RRR larger if necessary, we see that

μn((−∞,−R]∪(R,∞))<ε\mu_n\p{\poc{-\infty, -R} \cup \p{R, \infty}} < \epsilonμn​((−∞,−R]∪(R,∞))<ε

for n≥Nn \geq Nn≥N.

Let fff be a bounded continuous function and ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0. Since fff is bounded, we know that fff can be approximated uniformly by simple functions (regardless of sign of fff) on compact sets, so let ggg be a simple function such that ∥f−g∥L∞(B(0,R))<ε\norm{f - g}_{L^\infty\p{B\p{0,R}}} < \epsilon∥f−g∥L∞(B(0,R))​<ε.

Making NNN larger if necessary, we may assume that if n,m≥Nn, m \geq Nn,m≥N, then ∣∫g dμn−∫g dμm∣<ε\abs{\int g \,\diff\mu_n - \int g \,\diff\mu_m} < \epsilon∣∣​∫gdμn​−∫gdμm​∣∣​<ε. Hence, if MMM is an upper bound for fff,

∣∫f dμn−∫f dμm∣≤∣∫B(0,R)f dμn−∫B(0,R)g dμn∣+∣∫B(0,R)f dμm−∫B(0,R)g dμm∣+∣∫B(0,R)g dμn−∫B(0,R)g dμm∣+∣∫B(0,R)cf dμn−∫B(0,R)cf dμm∣≤εμn(R)+εμm(R)+ε+Mμn(B(0,R)c)+Mμm(B(0,R)c)≤3ε+2Mε.\begin{aligned} \abs{\int f \,\diff\mu_n - \int f \,\diff\mu_m} &\leq \abs{\int_{B\p{0,R}} f \,\diff\mu_n - \int_{B\p{0,R}} g \,\diff\mu_n} + \abs{\int_{B\p{0,R}} f \,\diff\mu_m - \int_{B\p{0,R}} g \,\diff\mu_m} + \abs{\int_{B\p{0,R}} g \,\diff\mu_n - \int_{B\p{0,R}} g \,\diff\mu_m} + \abs{\int_{B\p{0,R}^\comp} f \,\diff\mu_n - \int_{B\p{0,R}^\comp} f \,\diff\mu_m} \\ &\leq \epsilon \mu_n\p{\R} + \epsilon \mu_m\p{\R} + \epsilon + M\mu_n\p{B\p{0,R}^\comp} + M\mu_m\p{B\p{0,R}^\comp} \\ &\leq 3\epsilon + 2M\epsilon. \end{aligned}∣∣​∫fdμn​−∫fdμm​∣∣​​≤∣∣​∫B(0,R)​fdμn​−∫B(0,R)​gdμn​∣∣​+∣∣​∫B(0,R)​fdμm​−∫B(0,R)​gdμm​∣∣​+∣∣​∫B(0,R)​gdμn​−∫B(0,R)​gdμm​∣∣​+∣∣​∫B(0,R)c​fdμn​−∫B(0,R)c​fdμm​∣∣​≤εμn​(R)+εμm​(R)+ε+Mμn​(B(0,R)c)+Mμm​(B(0,R)c)≤3ε+2Mε.​

Sending ε→0\epsilon \to 0ε→0, we get the claim.
